title: 2  Unimodal Function and Search Methods
text:
2.1 Unimodal Function
A function \(f\) is unimodal if there exists only one maximum (minimum) point for maximization (minimization) problem. This means that the function increases in value up to a certain point, then decreases in value after reaching its maximum point. With unimodal functions, any extreme you find is guaranteed to be the global extreme. Perhaps the concept of unimodality is better grasped through an example. Consider the function \(f(x)\) defined as
\[
f(x) = (x + 2)^2
\]
